metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: A small, 50-something, nervous-looking Italian man who works in the Bel Inc. corridor buffing and maintaining the shoes of executives and brokers. He is a background service worker whose actual name is unknown to and seemingly unimportant to those around him. He is obedient and deferential, responding promptly and agreeably to the demands of those he serves.
data.dialogue_summary: The Shoe Repair Guy speaks only two brief lines, both affirmative responses to the executives he serves: 'You got 'er Mr. Hinkley' to Abe, and 'You got it, Mr. Lavery' to Xander. His dialogue is entirely subservient and transactional, reflecting his role as an invisible service worker.
